availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James H. Sears (Nicholas County, Kentucky, constable)

body.p: Nicholas County, Kentucky, constable. Kentucky native. Son of Jonas Sears and Anna Sears. Father of William S. Sears, Joseph Sears, J.C.B. Sears. Married Sarah F. Ellington in Nicholas County, Kentucky on January 7, 1851. Resident of Nicolas County, Kentucky in 1850. Constable in Nicholas County, Kentucky in 1860. Enrolled for military duty in seventh District of Kentucky in July 1863 (U.S.A). Signed Jonathan Youngâ€™s pardon to Governor Thomas Bramlette.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas County, District 1, p. 87.Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas County, District 1, p. 299. Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Nicholas County Marriages, Film 000252408. Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Nicholas County, KY, May 1865, p. 27, (Accessed via ancestry.com). KYR-0001-004-3230.
